author: Michelle
content:
The hidden gem of Manchester, if you're wanting frills then this isn't the place for you, but if you're wanting good decent food at a very good price then this is the place to go. We chose the 3 meat with rice for £8, we got keema and peas, chicken curry and chicken tikka and a plain naan for £1.50, all tasted amazing, perfectly cooked and very filling.
The real testament was how busy it is, the guy next to us said it was his third time this week, another said 2nd time this week.
If you're in Manchester this place is worth the visit.
